name.japanese: フロリアントライアングル

description: A mysterious, foggy stretch of sea in Paradise where many ships have disappeared. This is where the Rumbar Pirates met their tragic end and where Brook drifted for 50 years.

keyEvents.title: Rumbar Pirates Ambushed
keyEvents.description: The Rumbar Pirates are attacked by enemy pirates using poisoned weapons in the Florian Triangle.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the Rumbar Pirates' journey ended and Brook's 50-year solitude began.

keyEvents.title: Final Performance of Bink's Sake
keyEvents.description: The Rumbar Pirates perform their final song in the Florian Triangle while dying from poison.
keyEvents.significance: One of the most emotional moments in One Piece, taking place in this mysterious and tragic location.

statusHistory.reason: Ongoing mysterious region in the Grand Line

description: A massive island-sized ship commanded by Gecko Moria, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. It serves as the setting for the present-day celebration of Bink's Sake.

keyEvents.title: Brook Reveals the Tone Dial
keyEvents.description: Brook reveals the Tone Dial he's been carrying inside his skull while at Thriller Bark.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Brook finally shares his crew's legacy with new friends.

keyEvents.title: Present Day Celebration
keyEvents.description: Everyone at Thriller Bark sings and dances to Bink's Sake while Brook plays piano and the Tone Dial recording plays.
keyEvents.significance: Transforms Thriller Bark from a place of horror into a place of joy and celebration, showing how the Rumbar Pirates' spirit lives on.

description: The ship used by the Rumbar Pirates during their journey through the Grand Line. After the crew's death, it became Brook's floating prison for 50 years in the Florian Triangle.

keyEvents.title: Yorki's Illness Discovered
keyEvents.description: The crew discovers that Captain Yorki and others have contracted an incurable disease on their ship.
keyEvents.significance: The beginning of the Rumbar Pirates' tragic end.

keyEvents.title: Recording of Bink's Sake
keyEvents.description: The Rumbar Pirates perform and record their final song on this ship.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the final resting place of the Rumbar Pirates and witnesses their last performance.

keyEvents.title: Brook's 50 Years of Solitude
keyEvents.description: Brook drifts alone on the ghost ship for 50 years after his resurrection.
keyEvents.significance: The ship transforms from a vessel of joy and music into a lonely prison, emphasizing Brook's isolation.

statusHistory.reason: Ship was active during Rumbar Pirates' journey
Ship became a derelict ghost ship after crew's death, eventually destroyed
